awd_titl_txt: Student Travel Support for the 47th International Symposium on Computer Architecture (ISCA)
awd_abstract_narration:
The International Symposium on Computer Architecture (ISCA) is a premier forum for research on computer architecture, the hardware/software interface, and systems architecture. This award provides travel support for up to 50 students attending this flagship conference in May 2020 in Valencia, Spain. ISCA embraces systems research that directly targets these new problems in new ways. Historically, the conference has attracted top research papers from both academia and industry, and many innovations published in the proceedings have been influential in the history of the processor industry. The acceptance rates for submitted papers is typically between 15-20%.

This award will have two primary direct benefits. First, The ISCA conference is strengthened as a result of better student attendance that this travel support enables, since they are the next-generation of the research workforce in this domain. Second, those students receiving travel support personally benefit from the opportunity to interact with peers and experts, as well as to establish connections that will help their professional careers. An undergraduate workshop at the event is one part of the computer architecture communities' efforts towards increasing diversity, and the travel funding seeks to also support students from underrepresented groups within the undergraduate attendees at the event.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

por.por_cntn:
The International Symposium on Computer Architecture (ISCA) is a premier forum for research on computer architecture, the hardware/software interface, and systems architecture. This project aimed to support this flagship conference by obtaining travel support for students in order for them to mitigate the costs of attending and participating in the ISCA conference and its joint workshops during June 18-22, 2022 in New York City, USA. Priority was given to US citizens, permanent residents, and students studying in the US, followed by students from underrepresented groups, followed by students that will be presenting their research at ISCA or its joint workshops. Women and other under-represented groups were strongly encouraged to apply.

We awarded travel grants to the students to attend the conference including hotel, plane flights, and transportation to decrease the barrier to attend the conference. In total, we funded 40 students and each was awardeed a maximum of $500, of which 30% were underrepresented minorities and 70% were first time conference attendees. By targeting these two groups of students we are contributing to broadening participation in computing. Due to COVID, ISCA 2020 and 2021 were held online. This year, we invited authors of papers accepted at ISCA 2020 and 2021 to present their papers as posters. This gives the opportunity for authors who presented online in the prior years to have the opportunity to present in person. 32.5% of the awardees were workshop presenters, 47.5% were conference presenters, and 20% were invited poster presenters.

 


Last Modified: 08/14/2022
Modified by: Jieming Yin
